creator: hasani@hunterdynamics.com
text:
Weak auth for shutdown, the only prereqs are that the connecting ip address be
the same as the tomcat host.  Made socket connection to port 8007 and sent
(byte)254,(byte)15 array and server removed all contexts and shutdown
gracefully.  I started jakarta as root and was able to shut it down as my
regular test account.  OS: RedHat Linux 7.1. Is there a way to protect jakarta
from shutting down from unauthorized access?  I have searched bug database and
could not find any FAQ or reference so I appologize in advance if I overlooked
it. The severity is critical as you can cause a DOS (Denial of Service) by
shutting down the jakarta server as a regular user, and it would look as if the
server shutdown by itself.  Thank you.

Hasani Hunter
hasani@hunterdynamics.com

creator: cmanolache@yahoo.com
text: Resolved in 3.3, where you can add password auth.
